questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The sum of two irrational numbers is always irrational.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If a = 3.5 and b = 2.4 (both to 1 d.p.), then the minimum value of a × b is 3.45 × 2.35.
questions.explanation: Lower bounds: a ≥ 3.45, b ≥ 2.35. Minimum product = 3.45 × 2.35

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each expression to its simplified form.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps to rationalise 1/(√a + √b).
dragItems: Apply difference of squares to denominator
correctArrangement: Apply difference of squares to denominator
questions.explanation: Multiply by the conjugate to eliminate the surd in the denominator.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Express 0.23̄ (where only 3 repeats) as a fraction.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If x = 5 × 10⁸ and y = 2 × 10⁻³, calculate √(xy) in standard form.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: π/2 is an irrational number.
questions.explanation: If π/2 were rational, then π would be rational (since 2 × rational = rational). But π is irrational, so π/2 must be irrational.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each calculation to its answer.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve using the quadratic formula: x² + 5x + 3 = 0. Give answers in surd form.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Complete the square for x² + 8x + 10.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Simplify: (x² - 9)/(x² - x - 6)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve simultaneously: y = x² - 3 and y = 2x

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The equation x² + 4x + 5 = 0 has no real solutions.
questions.explanation: Discriminant = b² - 4ac = 16 - 20 = -4 < 0, so no real solutions.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If f(x) = x² + 2x, then f(a + 1) = a² + 4a + 3.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the inverse function of f(x) = (2x + 3)/(x - 1).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each function to its composite.
questions.explanation: fg(x) means f(g(x)) - apply g first, then f.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve the inequality: x² - 5x + 4 < 0
questions.explanation: x² - 5x + 4 = (x-1)(x-4). This is negative when 1 < x < 4.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps to solve a quadratic equation by completing the square.
questions.explanation: For x² + bx + c: halve b, square it, add and subtract to complete the square.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the range of f(x) = x² - 4x + 7.
questions.explanation: f(x) = (x-2)² + 3. Since (x-2)² ≥ 0, f(x) ≥ 3. Minimum value is 3.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Express 3/(x-2) + 2/(x+1) as a single fraction.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The nth term of a sequence is n² + 3n. Find the sum of the 5th and 6th terms.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The graph of y = (x - 2)² - 3 has vertex at (2, -3).
questions.explanation: In the form y = (x - h)² + k, the vertex is at (h, k). Here h = 2 and k = -3.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each quadratic to its discriminant nature.
questions.explanation: Discriminant = b² - 4ac. >0 means two roots, =0 means one repeated, <0 means no real roots.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the value of k for which x² + kx + 9 = 0 has equal roots.
questions.explanation: For equal roots, b² - 4ac = 0. k² - 36 = 0, so k = ±6

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve: 3^(2x) = 27

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Make r the subject of: A = P(1 + r)ⁿ

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order these to identify the number of solutions using the discriminant.
questions.explanation: The discriminant determines the nature and number of roots of a quadratic equation.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Given f(x) = 2x + 1 and g(x) = x² - 3, find x when fg(x) = 15.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: y is inversely proportional to x². When x = 2, y = 5. Find y when x = 4.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: £5000 is invested at 4% per annum compound interest. How long until it exceeds £6000?

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If y ∝ x³, then doubling x multiplies y by 8.
questions.explanation: If y = kx³ and x doubles to 2x, then y = k(2x)³ = 8kx³, so y is multiplied by 8.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The force F between two particles varies inversely as the square of the distance d. If F = 10 when d = 2, find F when d = 5.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each scenario to its proportionality type.

matchingPairs.left: Speed and time for fixed distance

questions.explanation: F ∝ 1/d², A ∝ r², speed ∝ 1/time, V ∝ edge³

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A radioactive substance decays by 20% each hour. After how many hours is less than 40% remaining?

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps to solve a proportion problem.
dragItems: Set up the equation y = kxⁿ or y = k/xⁿ
Use given values to find k
correctArrangement: Set up the equation y = kxⁿ or y = k/xⁿ
Use given values to find k
questions.explanation: First determine direct/inverse and power, then find k, then solve.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The period T of a pendulum is proportional to √L where L is the length. If T = 2 when L = 1, find T when L = 4.
questions.explanation: T = k√L. When L=1, T=2: k = 2. When L=4: T = 2√4 = 4

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If a population grows by 5% each year, it will double in approximately 14 years.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: x varies directly as y² and inversely as z. When x = 6, y = 3 and z = 2. Find x when y = 4 and z = 8.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Calculate the angle between a tangent to a circle and the radius at the point of contact.
questions.explanation: A tangent to a circle is always perpendicular to the radius at the point of contact.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: In triangle ABC, angle A = 40° and angle B = 75°. Find angle C.
questions.explanation: Angles in a triangle sum to 180°. C = 180° - 40° - 75° = 65°

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: In a circle, an angle at the centre is 120°. What is the angle at the circumference subtended by the same arc?
questions.explanation: The angle at the centre is twice the angle at the circumference. So angle at circumference = 120°/2 = 60°.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Opposite angles in a cyclic quadrilateral sum to 180°.
questions.explanation: In a cyclic quadrilateral inscribed in a circle, opposite angles are supplementary.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Two tangents from an external point to a circle are equal in length.
questions.explanation: Tangent segments from an external point to a circle are always equal in length.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the area of a triangle with sides 7 cm, 8 cm and included angle of 60°.
questions.explanation: Area = ½ab sin C = ½ × 7 × 8 × sin 60° = ½ × 56 × (√3/2) = 14√3 cm²

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: In triangle ABC, a = 5, b = 7, and C = 120°. Find c using the cosine rule.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each circle theorem to its statement.

matchingPairs.right: Angle between tangent and chord equals inscribed angle

questions.explanation: These are fundamental circle theorems used in geometry.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Using the sine rule, find angle B in triangle ABC where a = 10, b = 15, and A = 30°.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps to use the cosine rule to find an angle.
dragItems: Use inverse cosine to find A
correctArrangement: Use inverse cosine to find A
questions.explanation: When finding an angle, rearrange the cosine rule to make cos A the subject.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A ship sails 20 km on a bearing of 040°, then 30 km on a bearing of 130°. Find the direct distance from start.
questions.explanation: The angle between paths is 130° - 40° = 90°. Distance = √(20² + 30²) = √1300 ≈ 36.1 km

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the length of an arc in a circle of radius 8 cm with central angle 45°.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Two similar cones have radii in ratio 2:3. What is the ratio of their volumes?
questions.explanation: For similar solids, volume ratio = (length ratio)³ = (2/3)³ = 8/27

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The angle of elevation from A to B is equal to the angle of depression from B to A.
questions.explanation: Due to alternate angles with parallel horizontal lines, the angle of elevation equals the angle of depression.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each formula to its use.
questions.explanation: Different formulas are used depending on the given information in a triangle.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A tower casts a shadow of 50m when the angle of elevation of the sun is 35°. Find the height of the tower.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the gradient of the line perpendicular to y = 3x - 2.
questions.explanation: Perpendicular gradients multiply to -1. If m₁ = 3, then m₂ = -1/3

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps to solve a 3D trigonometry problem.
dragItems: Identify the right triangle in the 3D shape
Label all known lengths and angles
Find the required length or angle
correctArrangement: Identify the right triangle in the 3D shape
Label all known lengths and angles
Find the required length or angle
questions.explanation: 3D problems often require identifying 2D right triangles within the 3D shape.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A cuboid has dimensions 4 × 5 × 12 cm. Find the length of the space diagonal.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.explanation: sin θ = cos(90° - θ), so sin 30° = cos 60° = 0.5

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: P(A) = 0.6 and P(B|A) = 0.5. Find P(A and B).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A bag contains 6 red and 4 blue balls. Two are drawn without replacement. Find P(same colour).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If events A and B are independent, then P(A|B) = P(A).
questions.explanation: For independent events, knowing B occurred doesn't change the probability of A.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The standard deviation measures the spread of data around the mean.
questions.explanation: Standard deviation quantifies how much individual data points deviate from the mean.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Data: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10. Calculate the variance.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each term to its definition.
questions.explanation: These are key statistical concepts for analyzing data and probability.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A random variable X has P(X=1) = 0.2, P(X=2) = 0.5, P(X=3) = 0.3. Find E(X).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps to draw a histogram from grouped data.
dragItems: Calculate frequency density for each class
correctArrangement: Calculate frequency density for each class
questions.explanation: Frequency density = frequency ÷ class width. Bars touch and have varying widths if classes differ.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: In a Venn diagram, P(A) = 0.5, P(B) = 0.4, P(A ∩ B) = 0.2. Find P(A ∪ B).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A test has P(positive|disease) = 0.95 and P(positive|no disease) = 0.05. If P(disease) = 0.01, find P(disease|positive).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A scatter diagram showing negative correlation has a line of best fit with negative gradient.
questions.explanation: Negative correlation means as one variable increases, the other decreases, giving a negative gradient.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each probability concept to its formula.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The frequency density of a class 10-30 with frequency 40 is:
questions.explanation: Class width = 30 - 10 = 20. Frequency density = frequency/class width = 40/20 = 2

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Data with mean 50 and standard deviation 10. What percentage lies within 2 standard deviations (assuming normal distribution)?
questions.explanation: In a normal distribution, approximately 95% of data lies within 2 standard deviations of the mean.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the steps to calculate standard deviation.
dragItems: Find mean of squared deviations, then square root
correctArrangement: Find mean of squared deviations, then square root

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Simplify: (√7 + √3)²

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Express √(50/2) in simplest surd form.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve: x² - 6x + 8 = 0 by completing the square.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each function to its inverse.
questions.explanation: To find the inverse, swap x and y, then solve for y.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The sum of the first n terms of an arithmetic series is Sₙ = n² + 3n. Find the 10th term.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: In a circle, chord AB is 8 cm from the centre. If the radius is 10 cm, find the length of AB.
questions.explanation: Half chord = √(10² - 8²) = √36 = 6 cm. Full chord = 12 cm

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each 3D shape to its surface area formula.
questions.explanation: Each 3D shape has a specific formula for calculating its surface area.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find sin 150°.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order these trig values from smallest to largest.
questions.explanation: cos 120° = -0.5, sin 0° = 0, tan 45° = 1, sin 90° = 1. Actually tan 45° = sin 90° = 1, so they're equal.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A box has 5 defective items out of 20. Two items are selected randomly. Find P(at least one defective).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each sampling method to its description.
questions.explanation: Different sampling methods have different applications and levels of representativeness.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The surface area S of a sphere varies directly as r². If S = 100π when r = 5, find S when r = 3.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: If x = 2 + √3, then x + 1/x = 4.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Solve: 2x + y = 7, x² + y² = 25
questions.explanation: From 2x + y = 7: y = 7 - 2x. Substitute: x² + (7-2x)² = 25 → 5x² - 28x + 24 = 0 → x = 4 or x = 0. Solutions: (4, -1) and (0, 5).

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Vector a = (3, -1) and b = (1, 4). Find |a + b|.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Match each vector operation to its result for a = (2, 3) and b = (1, -2).
questions.explanation: Vector addition and subtraction work component by component.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Order the correlation coefficients from weakest to strongest relationship.
questions.explanation: Strength is determined by |r|. 0.1, 0.5, 0.7, 0.9 from weakest to strongest.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: The graph of y = -x² + 4x - 3 has a maximum point.
questions.explanation: The coefficient of x² is negative, so the parabola opens downward, giving a maximum.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: A cone has base radius 3 cm and slant height 5 cm. Find its curved surface area.
questions.explanation: Curved surface area = πrl = π × 3 × 5 = 15π cm²

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.questionText: Find the error bound for (5.2 ± 0.05) × (3.1 ± 0.05) using maximum and minimum values.
